problems.title: Insert an Element in a Min Heap
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given an existing Min Heap of size N and one additional value X.
Insert X into the Min Heap and maintain the min heap property using upward heapify.
Finally, print the updated heap array in a single line separated by spaces.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5
2 4 6 8 10
1

Sample Output
1 4 2 8 10 6

Explanation:
After inserting 1 at end and applying upward heapify, the heap becomes 1 4 2 8 10 6

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def insertElement(self, heap, value):
        # TODO: Insert value and apply upward heapify
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split()
    N = int(data[0])
    heap = list(map(int, data[1:N+1]))
    X = int(data[N+1])
    sol = Solution()
    sol.insertElement(heap, X)
    print(*heap)

hintsList: Insert element at the end and compare it with its parent.
Swap until parent is smaller. Parent index = (i - 1) / 2.
